page.title: 01History and Location
page.content: Halifax has a population of 90 000. It is situated on the edge of the Pennines in the West Riding of Yorkshire.Its traditional industry was wool-processing which gave it prosperity,first in the late middle ages,and again in the Victorian age,when the town grew to its present size and the characteristic stone mills and terraces of houses were built. The oldest part of the town nestles in the valley of the Hebble around the magnificent medieval parish church in the Perpendicular style,but it later expanded up the surrounding steep hills. Halifax is within easy reach,by car or train,of larger cities such as Leeds and Manchester,and from every part of the town there are views of open hills and pastures.
